alert.note: Alert for Lafayette; Panola (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 27 at 10:01PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Lafayette and northeastern Panola Counties through 1030 PM CDT... At 1000 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over John W Kyle State Park, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oxford, Batesville, Holly Springs National Forest, John W Kyle State Park, Sardis, Springdale, Burgess, Taylor, College Hill Station, College Hill and Hayes Crossing. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for northwestern Mississippi.
